item.description: Mendeley API for Jekyll Finally finished off my Mendeley API for Jekyll (The top uses the Ruby API implementation from Michael Bus, copied here since it is not yet provided as a gem. scroll to the bottom for my plugin code). The Mendeley API implementation is remarkably clumsy. For instance, rather than allowing queries to the API that specify a user’s folder and a sort-by field, we are forced to first query the folder for a list of IDs and then query document details on every document in the folder, after which we can sort locally.
